title: Manager, Security Developer Tools
summary: Apple’s dynamic program analysis tools help millions of developers inside and outside of Apple find, fix, and prevent security and stability bugs. Seeking a manager with a background in systems-level developer tooling to lead a team developing new bug-finding tools.
description: In this role your primary responsibility will be to manage and support a small team of deeply technical dynamic analysis engineers who ship tools to fix software bugs to millions of users. Collaborate closely with operating systems engineers and security engineers.
key_qualifications: 5+ years experience leading a technical team, experience developing low-level development tools, experience hiring engineers, strong communication and organizational skills, excellent software engineering, testing, and debugging ability.
education_experience: B.S. in Computer Science or equivalent experience
additional_requirements: Knowledge of dynamic analysis techniques (such as Sanitizers or Valgrind) or of past, current, and emerging security exploits is a plus
pay_benefits: At Apple, base pay for this role is between $181,000 and $313,000. Additionally, receive benefits such as medical and dental coverage, retirement benefits, discounted products and free services, and reimbursement for certain educational expenses.
